reviews.sentence: Always Fun. Room was well kept very clean. Bathroom in good shape and the towels at Harahs are absolutely the best better than my spa. Amenities are above satisfactory. Maintenance staff more than helpful and friendly.

Personal concierge and more. My last couple times at Harahs casino I have had the pleasure of Ivy a personal concierge that texts my phone when I arrive to welcome me and my family to the casino and asks if we need anything from a bath towel to directions to the new gym. she it right there at my service. I love it. Wa to go Harahs. I also want to thank the staff for always making me feel at home.

The hotel was beautiful. I got my workout just walking to the convention center from my elevator. Giggle. The food was wonderful. Such a great variety of delicious items to choose from. I guess the walking was worth it. Smile. Keep up the great work.

Amazing. Room was comfy. Staff was friendly and caring pool and fitness room was amazing and casino always a good time. Will definitely recommend my friends and family to enjoy the atmosphere and to have a great time.

Lauren the lifeguard our server at McCormick and Schmicks Quan from the spa each of them went above and beyond their expectations for us. Ensuring that we will return to stay many times over. And the gentleman working at the Waterfront Buffet thank you for sending my world into a whirlwind. I hope I find you again in this life. see you soon Harahs.

Enjoyable. Nice rooms at good rates good service and staff very friendly had no issues at all even won at tables which I rarely do will recommend harahs to anyone who asks they will have fun lots of activities and fun.

Matthews Review. The room was nice and the Pool is awesome. The Pool Red Door Spa and the Pool At Night are great. I also love AC Burger Orogold and the Exibition Bar. The live bands dancers djs and Staff at the Pool at night are the best. Special shout out to the Victoria Watts Band.

Girls Spa weekend. We were a group of girls celebrating a birthday and had a girls weekend spa getaway. We booked spa massages facials and body treatments at The Red Door Spa. We had dinner at McCormick and Schmicks the first night. Our room was in much need of an update. The window was broken and taped up with a plexiglass type barrier over the broken window. Our room had an old smiley musty smell to it. Walls were paper thin we could hear what was going on in the room next door and the noisy people in the middle of the night loudly partying back to their rooms. The bathroom had hair on the floor and was not swept what looked like for a few days. We called housekeeping for more towels and sheets and the wait was not long about 20 minutes. They had live entertainment with no cover fee. We had a fun spa getaway.

Harahs is an inviting hotel with friendly staff. Check in for the hotel is quick and easy. They offer a range of rooms and you may want to check if you are being placed in a renovated portion of the hotel. Great indoor pool and fitness center. One downside is it sits off the boardwalk without easy pedestrian access but is a quick ride by car or taxi to anywhere you may want to go. The casino offers a range of slots and table games with some good restaurant choices including the AC Burger Co a great casual dining option.

Fun AC Casino. If you want to get away for a fun night or two in AC Harahs Casino is a good bet. It has everything you are looking for a Resort Casino Hotel table games slots bars restaurants pool spa entertainment etc. You can have a great time without leaving the property. Rooms are clean and comfortable service is good.

Away from home. The room was clean and spa like but it was too far from the elevators I walk with a cane. I would had been happier and in less pain if the room was closer to the elevators. Excellent room service was provided each day.

Harahs Resort Atlantic City is an all in one place. You never have to leave the building. That being said there is room for improvement. ROOM We had a King no smoking room which smelled faintly of smoke. The bed was very comfortable. The shower was hot and had very good pressure. The climate controls were perfect. The room was a standard Hotel room nothing special. It seemed slightly run down. There is no telling how many people slept in it before us. FOOD This is where the Resort shines. We visited an asian restaurant which had authentic food. I recommend the Pho. We went to a traditional American place called AC Burger Co which was perfect. We also had breakfast at Costal Craft Kitchen which was one of the best breakfasts I have had in a while. Everything perfect. The prices were higher than normal but it was worth it. ACTIVITIES There is no shortage of activities in Harahs. They have a very nice pool where pick up games of pool volley ball were happening. A nice relaxing hot tub. We went for a massage at the Red Door Spa. And at night the Pool becomes a night club.

Good. It ’s A great place but compared to the other resorts in the area there ’s not as much group activities. Just the pool The actual location sucks it ’s away from everything and Atlantic City is filled with crackheads.

I really enjoyed my stay. We had a room in the Atrium. It was very clean and we really enjoyed the spacious living area where you could sit and watch TV separate from where the bed was. The king size bed was nice and comfortable. I also used the gym while I was there and it had a variety of machines and they were all newer. I also love that there is a Starbucks inside the hotel too. Great casino to stay at.

Red Door Spa. When I go to Harahs in Atlantic City I always go to Red Door Spa. I been going there for the pass 4 years. They have Professional and friendly staff at Red Door Spa with exceptional masseurs. My favorite is Mr Sedat his knowledge and professionalism are always be young my expectations. When I am stress I tent to get Knots in my right shoulder. Once I come out I feel brand new my results has been phenomenal I walk out of there brand new. Thank You Mr Sedat for your continues professionalism you are the best.

Great time. We recently stayed 3 nights in the Bay Tower at Harahs and had a wonderful time. Accommodations were lovely neat and clean. I went to the Red Door Spa and the services I had were amazing. great place to enjoy and relax. We ate dinner at Gordon Ramseys and everything item we ordered was absolutely delicious. We shared a long bone tomahawk steak which was very tender and rich with flavor. I would highly recommend the spa and Gordon Ramseys. We saw a very entertaining show called Legends a really talented cast. My casino host Edward Taylor is very detail oriented and I can always be rest assured everything will be perfectly arranged.

Not great but bot bad. Not great but bot bad. Overall the hotel was great. But I was not a big fan of the casino. The casino seemed very out dated. The new sports book was way smaller than what I thought it would be. But overall my stay was good.

Could have been better. I stayed at Harahs for a work conference and was somewhat disappointed. The location is alright fairly easy to get to. it is almost straight shot from the AC and Phily airports. Its a casino obviously. So be prepared to walk through the casino to get to check in. I got a little lost but the staff pointed me in the right direction to check in. The staff was probably the best thing about the hotel. All the staff I interacted with were wonderful. For some reason I was put in the handicap hearing impaired room. the room was nice and large clean. But being a handicap room I can speak to what you can expect in regular room. Unfortunately for me the hearing impaired system was not working properly. So all night long the lights would start flashing. After many calls to the front desk a maintenance guy came and just unplugged everything. But it was a night of sleep lost. I will make sure from now one to ask for a regular room. The biggest disappointment was the pool situation. We are charged a 20 a day amenities fees primarily for the pool and gym. When I tried to go down to the pool I was told that it was The Pool and I had to pay to go in. When I asked about the amenities fee I was told that was for the other pool which was closed. The gym was decent. It overlooked the pool I could go in. The conference hall is large. Plenty of rooms to accommodate whatever setup you need. The AV staff were on point. The only downside was how things the walls and floor were. The meeting on the floor below us was having a rager. The music was so loud that the floor was shaking and our audio equipment picked up the sound. So if you choose to have a conference there try to get on the first floor.

I m a young miner so I can not go to the casino area and at the time I was not a guest so I did not have access to the pool or gym so I did not have much to do I walked around the mall area and even then still nothing the stores there where trash the stuff was too expensive their was a shirt that was o er 100 see that was a problem I was on a budget it was too much so I spent 3 hours in Starbucks this whole was not very child friendly. Thank you.

They tout the party and the hotel is showing the abuse. Been doing several trips every year for the past 10 years. Each trip there is more and more promotion about the party atmosphere. The abuse is showing. Sticky dirty floors trashed elevators wear and tear of tables chairs in lounges is showing. And if it ’s not a party night during the week amenities are limited. None of the signature restaurants open on a Monday night. McCormick and Schmidt ’s is open but is highly understaffed. That leaves the limited menu at Coastal cafe or the awful AC burger joint or overpriced Buffet for dinner options. The Red Door SPA is overpriced rude staff who outright lie. The hot tub is still out of order 14 months later. They will tell you it ’s just that week. Really because 7 out of 7 trips since Dec 2017 it has been put if order. Pool hot tubs. 2 of 5 work. An improvement over 1 of 5. Sadly we are looking for new options for our next trip. This place is n’t aging well.

Very relaxing and much needed. The room was so nice I almost did n’t want to leave. Great gym 247. Poker and sports betting I just wish I had time for the pool. Very clean great customer service. Buffet was decent could have been a little more selection. And even had a few events.

Great three days at Harah ’s. Just back from three days at Harah ’s Atlantic City Wed Sat. Great gaming. High Limit Slots are very fair plenty of low limit slots on main floor friendly table game workers. Would like more 5 tables and more games to bet on at sports book ex English Championship league. Food was good. One of best diamond lounges in whole Harah ’s system. Restaurant choices were top notch but would have appreciated a top notch seafood mainly restaurant. Pool was better than most Vegas properties but would like longer hours. Room was clean and quiet bathroom roomy and looked brand new. a c worked perfectly and was quiet. Shuttle 10am1pm to Boardwalk daily. Will definitely return.

do not like it anymore. it is on a slippery slope heading to the bottom. Food offerings are below average housekeeping is questionable. Do not like that guests can forego daily room service for a 10 reduction in their room charge. Do you know haw nasty a room can get without daily cleaning and an ability of staff to alert management to questionable activities in the room they clean.

Kid Organized event. Restaurant choices cleanliness of rooms and restrooms friendly staff. Our renovated room was nice and clean. We used room service once food was well prepared and service was quick however prices were extremely high. Uncomfortable beds pillows terrible. Noise level is not controlled can hear neighboring rooms through vents all night. People smoking on non smoking floors is not monitored and smelled people smoking pot on casino level several times. We stayed there for an organized volleyball tournament for kids and there were no activities for kids available or open so there was nothing to do with kids after playtime was over. Price of the rooms were too high for the event.

Zero ZERO customer service. Harah ’s hosted a volleyball tourney and clearly did not have the resources to deal with the guests. “ Opt our of housekeeping and save 10 ” You can always get fresh towels by calling housekeeping. Hum The phone in the room does n’t work. Walk down to the front desk. Stand in line for 25 minutes just to talk to somebody. They say somebody will be up with towels. Nope. Ask for a cot. “ ok someone will wheel one up ”. 1030 pm 10 hours waiting for towels 5 hours waiting for cot. “ We do n’t have cots and housekeeping is backed up ”. So my daughter had to sleep on 2 chairs pushed together with sweatshirts for sheets we could have used towels. but oh yeah we still NEVER GOT any. Vomit in the hallways. old stank smoke smell in some rooms that was was so bad it was making people sick. The casino seemed nice but I would very much advise against not staying overnight.

The best aspect is the MYND. Spent a few days here while accompanying my partner at a conference event. Was n’t impressed. One example we 3 times requested our room to be serviced on one day and returned 11 at night to find it still was n’t. Am reviewing some fine dining options separately so here will focus on Spa given it does n’t seem possible to review it under its new name directly. So this is review of MYND used to be Red Door. Spa in Harahs. Had planned to walk the Boardwalk but a Rainy day in Atlantic City put paid to that idea. Stuck in a not great resort hotel while husband attended a conference. so what else could a girl do but have a massage. I tend to only have the shortest possible massage in a new spa with an unknown therapist as I like a really firm touch and find many provide ‘ oil spreader ’ service. Had a 25 min mini massage deep tissue with DEIRDRE who was excellent and had a nice firm touch. The spa itself was also lovely with a few nice relaxation spaces including one with a nice fire feature by a small jet pool which was great for relaxing in and reading a book. Pricing high I thought for off season 70 for 25 mins and an extra 25 for ‘ adon ’ of deep tissue. but it was a good massage. And I had a nice chill out hour which helped me make the most of a rainy vacation day stuck inside.
